snippet: Mr. Brat’s ability to connect with voters and the perception that Eric Cantor was not engaged in his district combined to deliver one of the most stunning upsets in modern political history.
abstract: David Brat’s victory over House Majority Leader Eric Cantor in Virginia's Republican primary was combination of Brat's ability to connect with voters and perception that Cantor was not engaged in his district; outcome represents one of the most stunning upsets in modern political history, and is a turning of the tables by Brat on Virginia Republican establishment that once snubbed him.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Trip Gabriel from Glen Allen, Va., Jonathan Martin and David S. Joachim from Washington, and Kitty Bennett from St. Petersburg, Fla.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Brat’s ability to connect with voters and the perception that Eric Cantor was not engaged in his district combined to deliver one of the most stunning upsets in modern political history.

headline.main: Once Snubbed, David Brat Turns the Tables
